item.title: “Coffee & Art” Continues January 31
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. item.title: Don’t Miss the Big Red Freakout!
item.description: Date: Saturday, February 1, 2025 4:30 PM - 11:30 PM - Join other RPI hockey fans to enjoy a buffet dinner, have face painting and “tattoos” done courtesy of the Red & White Student Organization, and enjoy a Pep Band performance! After the game, take the shuttle back to the Heffner Alumni House to meet the men’s hockey team and coaches, enjoy a cash bar and complimentary hot drinks, desserts, and snacks.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Critical Intimacies” Event to Feature Filmmaker Thuy-Han Nguyen-Chi, Researcher Katie Kirkland
item.description: Date: Friday, January 31, 2025 7:00 PM - How can we practice critical intimacy in art, cinema, and theory? Register for this lecture from artist and filmmaker Thuy-Han Nguyen-Chi, with writer and researcher Katie Kirkland, to encounter artistic and theoretical works by female practitioners with East and Southeast Asian ancestry whose work grapples with legacies of Western imperialism.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting, “Put Your Data on Maps with Leaflet in R!,” to be Held January 29
item.description: RPI R users are invited to meeting of RPIrates, the RPI R Users Group! This week’s topic will be “Put Your Data on Maps with Leaflet in R!,” led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations of the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer. The session will discuss how R’s Leaflet package makes it easy for users to create interactive maps that present data analyses in powerful, compelling, geographically-relevant ways.

item.title: MBA for Professionals Informational Webinar Scheduled for January 30
item.description:
Date: Thursday, January 30, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D. as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
